Allen City Council

The City of Allen operates under a council-manager form of government, approved by voters in 1979 through the adoption of the Allen City Charter. The Allen City Council consists of the mayor and six councilmembers, all elected citywide, not by district. Both the mayor and councilmembers serve staggered three-year terms.

What Does the City Council Do?

The City Council is responsible for:

  • Setting city policy
  • Approving the annual budget
  • Engaging in strategic planning for the city's future
Back to top

City Council Meeting Agendas and Minutes

  • Available online at least three business days prior to the meeting. A paper copy is posted outside Allen City Hall in the public notice case by the main entrance. View upcoming agendas.
Back to top

Attending Meetings and Addressing the City Council

City Council meetings are held on the second and fourth Tuesday of each month at 7 p.m. in the Council Chambers at Allen City Hall, 305 Century Parkway. Prior to the meeting, there’s a workshop at 6 p.m. in the Council Conference Room. Both the meetings and workshops are open to the public.

You can address the City Council on both agenda and non-agenda items. Here’s how:

  • The Public Speaker Request Form is available online starting the Friday before the meeting at 5 p.m. and until 5 p.m. on the meeting day. After 5 p.m., paper forms are available in the Council Chambers.
  • Paper forms must be handed to the City Secretary before the meeting begins.
  • When called, go to the podium, state your name and address for the record, and discuss your topic. Groups are encouraged to select one spokesperson.
